Kim and I sat down and looked at this bug today. It turns out that this problem
occurs when an editor is hidden and that the chevron is used to make it visible.
We realized that using "Ctrl+F6" worked fine for this bug. Single tab mode is
not a necessity to replicate this issue. We were able to reproduce this problem
by opening several files until the chevron appears. Restarting eclipse and
making the hidden editor(s) visible would cause this problem (on the Mac but not
on Windows).  This is an issue for .class, .java and text files as well.

It turns out that the "busyRestoreEditor()" method is being called twice on the
same editor. This is due to the fact that an "SWT.Activate" event is triggered
on a shell during the "busyRestoreEditor()" method, which would cause a sequence
of events that would call that same method again.

Long story short, Kim found a work around and will post a patch on Monday. There
will also be a bug logged against SWT to report this difference in behavior on
the Mac and on Windows regarding the "SWT.Activate" event. It's still unclear
why, how or when the latter event is being triggered on one platform and or
another. We have not tried this problem on Linux yet. There could be a similar
issue.

Created an attachment (id=11640)
Patch against BasicStackList

This patch changes the order of operations when a user selects a file from the
chevron/ctrl-e editor list.  Previously we would open the editor then close the
dialog.  This patch causes the dialog to be closed first.  Even though this
covers	up another issue with the shell activation, I believe it's the right
thing to do.  We shouldn't be opening the new editor under the window - we
should be closing it first.

Fix submitted into HEAD with TC.
